intro: Deinandra greeneana var. peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular Deinandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. This variant is distinguished by its geographic distribution and specific morphological traits compared to other Deinandra species.
